job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in Arlington, VA
pros: Nice place to work for
cons: No cons , not anything to say

job_title: Home Health Caregiver in Roanoke, VA
pros: Let you make your own hours
cons: Require alot of your time, need live in aids

pros: 1 client,Moore comfortable for client
cons: not haven enough staff... all the right equipment and supplies

pros: Offers hospice and meals on wheels for the community. Some clinical and other staff easy to work with.
cons: Management. They do not listen to employee concerns and it is ran by a person that cares more about themselves and sr. leadership than staff. Many positive reviews on this site are done by Sr. level management and they try to convince staff to write them also to bring up their ratings. Just as it states on this site it is against policy to do this, however they don't even follow HHU policy so why follow anyone else's. If you have problems with management, staff, or other concerns, they retaliate against you, and HR does not take it seriously. They expect you to work more and harder for less with no regard for you to have work/life balance. Sr. management's mission statement is actually "no money, no mission". Many departments are ran terribly due to no management because they leave due to poor working environment or lack of management. They run out good employees and keep the cancer. You are either written up or talked to if you need to leave your workstation due to family issues Do not fall for the sign on bonus either. Use extreme caution when applying with this company. Other great options out there.

review_title: A Company That Truly Embodies Their Mission, Vision and Values!
pros:
Employing staff with great customer service-knowledgeable, helpful, supportive, and friendly!
Value staff and their contributions in making Home Health United a great company.
Commitment to the community-Home Health United provides a multitude of services to the community to make a difference in individuals quality of life.
Ethical Company
Caring-in all aspects: personal interaction, professional interactions and patient interactions!
cons: Turning a "con" into a positive-Home Health United faces challenges as does any company.  Home Health United views those challenges as a learning experience and develop an effective strategy to overcome those challenges.

job_title: Customer Service Representative in Madison, WI
pros: Co corkers keep you sane, free nasty coffee and powdered creamer,nice working hours if you ever leave on time,nice big desk for your tons if work
cons:
-Management doesn't seem to care about employees only about the revenue for the company and the patients
 -you can expect a measly 2-3% raise yearly and that's it! No incentives or anything though out the year 
-PTO is earned and all combined with your sick time and everything else so don't you dare get sick,need a personal day or anything because your always stretched thin for time to use or go with out pay
-The moral is so depressing the environment just sucks the life right out of you,high turn over rate with staff, over worked - under paid
-Omg and the health insurance is terrible! 
Moral of the story is: The stress is just not worth it

pros: Best of Madison Gold, 4.5 stars from CMS,  10 years Home Care Elite, accountability important.  Negative reviews reflect staff that take no ownership in their jobs and patients.  Expectations are high to achieve these accolades which is good for excellent patient care!
cons: Healthcare is challenging with reimbursement cuts.  Makes it difficult to attract quality employees who want to strive for the best care.

pros: Smaller company that is growing and is cutting edge in technology. Working at the company is great because there isn't any corporate red tape or walls, change is welcome and accepted. The staff is like family, it is all about our patients.
cons: Being a smaller company and like most other companies today, the Health Insurance costs are going up and so are the deductibles.  This is probably because of the Affordable Care Act.

pros: its a job and payment is timely.
cons: Management preaches the rules but break them all the time with no repercussion. Many infractions buy management would get an hourly employee  fired immediately. Being employed by this company will eat at the soul of anyone who really cares about their work as the company does nothing to improve standards or employee satisfaction. The turn over rate is very high and is due to ignorant and rude management. This employer will affect your health negatively.

pros: the intake team was cool, I learned how to read Epic messages and navigate faxes, I liked my manager, people at the company are nice
cons: no professional development, stressful and boring, strict about phones and breaks so I didn't feel trusted, sometimes hard to get all the insurance information to verify benefits, not a lot of interaction with people in the office--it's kind of isolated,

pros: Ever changing environment.  Many different services to help patients in their homes.  Benefits are tied into owner org which creates some challenges.  Great people to work with.  Working to make changes to benefit all including the patients.
cons: Orientation for many positions needs to be improved.  New program to help improve orientation which has worked in other organizations.  Time will tell.

review_title: As a Non-profit Hospice, it's All about the money
job_title: Hospice Aide/Home Health Aide in Janesville, WI
pros: Patients and their families, good field staff teamwork.  Co-workers are caring towards patients and helpful to fellow peers
cons: Short-staffed, RN's overloaded. Field staff complains of negative work environment and management does nothing to correct the numerous complaints from both staff and patients. Instead they retaliate against employees who bring serious issues to their attention.  I agree with all the other negative reviews, look elsewhere.  Dont be fooled by the sign-on bonus, that shows they are desperate for help.

review_title: It was in the nursing field
job_title: Don't Want to Answer in Madison, WI
pros: The nurses and staff were nice.
cons: There are some pretty important issues that make it a difficult place to work.

pros:
Competent, caring staff
Great leadership -really cares about patient care and company reputation
Well established company -been around a long time
Company is diversified- offers many services and programs
cons: Fast paced environment can be difficult for those who can't multi-task or with poor decision-making skills.

job_title: Customer Service Representative in Madison, WI
pros: Location, hours I work, other staff members.
cons: Management at this company is a disaster. They are so catty and gossip about others. It is ridiculous and so unprofessional. When a manager or staff member leaves, they talk poorly of them and even disclose personal information about them and why they left/terminated. Maybe if they spent more time doing their jobs and doing it well instead of this poor behavior, people would not be losing their jobs, but it is easier for them to blame federal cuts then their poor leadership. As another reviewer of this site states, management will write positive reviews with 5 stars to up their star rating and/or ask staff members to do the same. They do not have morals or values Look at the review titled "Reimbursement Cuts from the Feds Create Challenges". Are we to believe the pros is management and the cons are staff? No staff member would ever state to get rid of all staff. It is pretty apparent they wrote this since they are getting so many negative reviews. I am currently looking for another job, and cannot wait for the day to give them my notice, though they don't even deserve a notice to be given. I dread getting up every day and going to that place. They are that difficult to work for. Hopefully the gossip about the majority owner buying out the minority owners is true and they come in and clean house.

review_title: Long waste of my time! Hospice
pros: Not really any besides work on your own
cons: Don't be fooled by there sign on bonus so not worth your time you will not have a life you are on call all the time , like 24hrs, sometimes 2-3 days a wk. working un godly hrs unsafe  don't care if you have a vacation will mandate you to work horrible hospice  management and leaderships " L"  they will support you or ever take blame for wrong doing and turn you in, very negative hospice  nurses

pros: Some coworkers are awesome.
cons: They've downsized a ton in the past 6 months due to losing profits. Management is lazy and greedy. They keep bad employees and they don't care about employees who work hard. The pay is bad. Other companies in town pay significantly more for similar jobs. The benefits are terrible. Management retaliated against employees who speak up. I had a coworker talk to management about her poorly run department and she was fired a few weeks later.

review_title: I love this company. The hospice is the best in Wisconsin!
pros: The work we do is amazing patient support. The hospice team is supported to really take care of the patients. Good management that trusts us.
cons: Less hours, more clinicians would help work life balance.

pros: Very nice people work here. The customer service and home care service provided is outstanding. If you're a patient--this is the place to be.
cons: It's a micro management philosophy they have. People who work here are not allowed any flexibility and management does not want to listen at all.  You're ideas for improvement are not welcome.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Sauk City, WI
pros: Work by yourself and enjoy my patients
cons: Too many patients that are too far apart from each other and not appreciated. It's a very stressful job.

pros: Good people, decent pay, prior CEO was an excellent leader
cons: Most of current leadership is negative, condescending and difficult to work for.  Financials are very much in the red.

job_title: Customer Service Representative in Madison, WI
pros: I had a steady pay check, but not enough to deal with the rhetoric
cons: Not enough people, very poor management, toxic environment, non-caring managers, poor parking, not enough pay for the amount of work, favoritism and coworkers don't help, no raises, and THIEVES

review_title: I wish I'd never become a nurse
job_title: RN Case Manager in Madison, WI
pros: Helping people is the only reason to work here. Your sacrifices will not go unnoticed by those you care for.
cons: The state of healthcare has created workplaces like this. Too stressful. Too impossible. It's hard to imagine a more difficult job.

pros: A lot of dedicated hard working employees.
cons: Inconsistent HR practices. Senior leadership does not listen when front line staff report ethical issues.

pros: There are no "pro's" to working at this company.
